alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 29 at 8:52AM EST until December 30 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Friday was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.7 feet on 04/17/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.6 Fri 8 am 4.1 3.9 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
